title: Update regarding HeavyTrucks Inc.
story_body:
HeavyTrucks Inc. (TRUCK) Antitrust Ruling Issued by DOJ and EU Regulators

At 08:00 EST, the United States Department of Justice (DOJ) and the European Union's (EU) antitrust regulators announced a joint ruling in the ongoing antitrust investigation into HeavyTrucks Inc. (TRUCK). The ruling, effective immediately, has significant implications for the company's future operations.

According to the DOJ and EU regulators, HeavyTrucks Inc. has been found to be in violation of antitrust laws due to its alleged anti-competitive practices in the heavy truck manufacturing market. The ruling requires HeavyTrucks Inc. to either divest certain assets or pay a substantial fine.

The exact terms of the ruling are as follows:

* HeavyTrucks Inc. must divest its heavy-duty transmission manufacturing division within 120 days.
* Alternatively, the company may choose to pay a fine of $500 million to be distributed equally between the DOJ and EU regulators.
* HeavyTrucks Inc. must also implement strict compliance measures to ensure adherence to antitrust laws in the future.

HeavyTrucks Inc. has not issued an official statement regarding the ruling at this time. The company's shares are expected to be affected by this development, and investors are advised to monitor the situation closely.

This ruling marks a significant development in the ongoing efforts of regulators to promote competition in the heavy truck manufacturing market. Further updates will be provided as more information becomes available.
